Caption: Figure 1: Multiple synchronous movement of cursors cover a                         large screen.
Mention:
We propose another method, called the “ninja cursor,” to 
reduce the ID by modifying cursor representation. It uses 
multiple cursors to reduce D without applying a prediction 
algorithm. The cursors move synchronously, following the 
physical movement of the mouse (Fig. 1). The user can 
point to a target with one of the cursors located nearest to it.
